meal.name: Ugali
meal.recipe: Bring water to a boil. Slowly add maize flour while stirring continuously. Keep stirring until the mixture thickens and forms a stiff porridge-like consistency. Serve hot with sukuma wiki, nyama choma, or stew.

meal.name: Sukuma Wiki
meal.recipe: Heat oil in a pan. Add chopped onions and cook until translucent. Add chopped sukuma wiki leaves and cook until wilted. Season with salt, pepper, and any desired spices. Serve hot with ugali or rice.

meal.name: Nyama Choma
meal.recipe: Marinate beef or goat meat with a mixture of spices, garlic, and ginger. Grill the meat over an open flame until cooked to desired doneness. Serve hot with kachumbari and ugali.

meal.name: Mandazi
meal.recipe: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and coconut milk to form a dough. Roll out the dough and cut into desired shapes. Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown. Serve warm as a snack or with tea.

meal.name: Githeri
meal.recipe: Boil a mixture of maize and beans until tender. Drain excess water if necessary. In a separate pan, saut√© onions, tomatoes, and spices. Add the boiled maize and beans to the pan and simmer until flavors meld. Serve hot.

meal.name: Chapati
meal.recipe: In a bowl, mix flour, water, salt, and oil to form a soft dough. Divide the dough into small balls and roll out each ball into a thin circle. Cook each circle on a hot griddle until golden brown spots appear on both sides. Serve hot.
